intro: Monnina wrightii, commonly known as Wright's monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other showy flowering plants like evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant adaptations. Wright's monkeyflower is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its resilience to arid conditions.
